greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primes p such that n divided by p leaves a prime remainder.
comment: Is there any n > 6 such that a(n) =0 ?
example: a(17) = 3: there are 3 primes viz. 3, 5 and 7 which leave prime remainders on dividing 17.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 01 2002
